trans-unit.source: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create clusters for Azure HDInsight by using Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create clusters for Azure HDInsight by using Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create HDInsight clusters using Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create HDInsight clusters using Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For other cluster creation tools and features click the tab select on the top of this page or see [Cluster creation methods](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#cluster-creation-methods).
trans-unit.target: For other cluster creation tools and features click the tab select on the top of this page or see [Cluster creation methods](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md#cluster-creation-methods).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI** - See [Install and configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) for installation and configuration information.
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI** - See [Install and configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) for installation and configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to connect to Azure:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to connect to Azure:

trans-unit.source: For more information on authenticating using a work or school account, see [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-connect.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on authenticating using a work or school account, see [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-connect.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to switch to the ARM mode:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to switch to the ARM mode:

trans-unit.source: To get help, use the **-h** switch.
trans-unit.target: To get help, use the **-h** switch.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Create clusters
trans-unit.target: Create clusters

trans-unit.source: You must have a Azure Resource Management (ARM), and a Azure Blob storage account before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must have a Azure Resource Management (ARM), and a Azure Blob storage account before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To create an HDInsight cluster, you must specify the following:
trans-unit.target: To create an HDInsight cluster, you must specify the following:

trans-unit.source: **Azure Resource Group**: A Data Lake Analytics account must be created within a Azure Resource group.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Resource Group**: A Data Lake Analytics account must be created within a Azure Resource group.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy, update or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy, update or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.

trans-unit.source: To list the resource groups in your subscription:
trans-unit.target: To list the resource groups in your subscription:

trans-unit.source: To create a new resource group:
trans-unit.target: To create a new resource group:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight cluster name**
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight cluster name**

trans-unit.source: **Location**: One of the Azure data centers that supports HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: One of the Azure data centers that supports HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported locations, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported locations, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **Default storage account**: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: **Default storage account**: HDInsight uses an Azure Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account is required before you can create an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Azure storage account:
trans-unit.target: To create a new Azure storage account:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Storage account must be collocated with HDInsight in the data center.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Storage account must be collocated with HDInsight in the data center.

trans-unit.source: The storage account type can't be ZRS, because ZRS doesn't support table.
trans-unit.target: The storage account type can't be ZRS, because ZRS doesn't support table.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure Portal, see [Create, manage, or delete a Storage account][azure-create-storageaccount].
trans-unit.target: For information on creating an Azure Storage account by using the Azure Portal, see [Create, manage, or delete a Storage account][azure-create-storageaccount].

trans-unit.source: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:
trans-unit.target: If you already have a Storage account but do not know the account name and account key, you can use the following commands to retrieve the information:

trans-unit.source: For details on getting the information by using the Azure Portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of [Create, manage, or delete a Storage account][azure-create-storageaccount].
trans-unit.target: For details on getting the information by using the Azure Portal, see the "View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys" section of [Create, manage, or delete a Storage account][azure-create-storageaccount].

trans-unit.source: **(Optional) Default Blob container**: The **azure hdinsight cluster create** command creates the container if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: **(Optional) Default Blob container**: The **azure hdinsight cluster create** command creates the container if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:
trans-unit.target: If you choose to create the container beforehand, you can use the following command:

trans-unit.source: azure storage container create --account-name "<Storage Account Name>" --account-key <Storage Account Key> [ContainerName]
trans-unit.target: azure storage container create --account-name "<Storage Account Name>" --account-key <Storage Account Key> [ContainerName]

trans-unit.source: Once you have the Storage account prepared, you are ready to create a cluster:
trans-unit.target: Once you have the Storage account prepared, you are ready to create a cluster:

trans-unit.source: Create clusters using configuration files
trans-unit.target: Create clusters using configuration files

trans-unit.source: Typically, you create an HDInsight cluster, run jobs on it, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you create an HDInsight cluster, run jobs on it, and then delete the cluster to cut down the cost.

trans-unit.source: The command-line interface gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: The command-line interface gives you the option to save the configurations into a file, so that you can reuse it every time you create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Example: Create a configuration file that contains a script action to run when creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Example: Create a configuration file that contains a script action to run when creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Create clusters with script action
trans-unit.target: Create clusters with script action

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration file that contains a script action to run when creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration file that contains a script action to run when creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Create a cluster with a script action
trans-unit.target: Create a cluster with a script action

trans-unit.source: For general script action information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action (Linux)](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For general script action information, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action (Linux)](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Create clusters using ARM templates
trans-unit.target: Create clusters using ARM templates

trans-unit.source: You can use CLI to create clusters by calling ARM templates.
trans-unit.target: You can use CLI to create clusters by calling ARM templates.

trans-unit.source: See [Deploy with Azure CLI](hdinsight-hadoop-create-windows-clusters-arm-templates.md#deploy-with-azure-cli).
trans-unit.target: See [Deploy with Azure CLI](hdinsight-hadoop-create-windows-clusters-arm-templates.md#deploy-with-azure-cli).
